RICHTER:
He have been concerned with now the Negro has reacted
TO AND COPED WITH THE VARIOUS LIMITATIONS AND DISCRIMIN
ATIONS THAT HAVE BEEN IMPOSED ON HIM IN AMERICAN LIFE.
• E HAVE NOT, HOWEVER, AS YET FACED UP SPECIFICALLY TO
THE QUESTION OF HOW THE NEGRO HAS STRIVEN TO IMPROVE
HIS LOT. And the moment one begins to think of this,
TWO THINGS MUST COME TO MIND: THE Negro’s PROTEST,
and the Negro’s Defense. Defense would encompass the
WORK OF SUCH ORGANIZATIONS AS THE NATIONAL URBAN LEAGUE
Commissions against discrimination, and so forth. Ve
SHALL BE DEALING WITH THESE NEXT WEEK. FoR THIS WEEK
WE WANT TO TREAT THE MATTER OF THE NEGRO PROTEST.
